response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22-year-old male)", "high", "Young adult males are statistically associated with higher recidivism risks due to behavioral trends and social pressures."],
    ["Ethnicity (Asian / Pacific Islander)", "low", "This demographic does not typically demonstrate elevated recidivism risk in studies."],
    ["Arrest history (1 arrest, no conviction)", "low", "A single arrest without a conviction is generally not a strong predictor of future criminal behavior."],
    ["Physical attributes (Height & Weight)", "low", "Physical measurements do not significantly correlate with recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital status (Never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of familial stability can correlate with moderately increased risk due to lower social support."],
    ["Educational attainment (Bachelor's degree)", "low", "Higher education is typically associated with lower recidivism risk due to better opportunities and improved decision-making."],
    ["Employment stability (3 jobs in a year)", "medium", "Multiple job changes can indicate instability which is moderately associated with increased risks."],
    ["Substance use (Marijuana use in past 4 years)", "medium", "Recent drug use, even with marijuana, can be indicative of a lifestyle that involves some risk factors for recidivism."],
    ["Mental health (No recent depression)", "low", "The absence of depressive symptoms suggests better psychological stability."],
    ["Childhood environment (Lived with biological mother in a small household in an urban area)", "medium", "Growing up in an urban environment can expose one to higher environmental risk factors despite family support."],
    ["Religious belief (Belief in divine influence)", "low", "A strong spiritual belief may serve as a protective factor by providing a support network and alternative coping mechanisms."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young adult males are statistically associated with higher recidivism risks due to behavioral trends and social pressures.
This demographic does not typically demonstrate elevated recidivism risk in studies.
A single arrest without a conviction is generally not a strong predictor of future criminal behavior.
Physical measurements do not significantly correlate with recidivism risk.
Lack of familial stability can correlate with moderately increased risk due to lower social support.
Higher education is typically associated with lower recidivism risk due to better opportunities and improved decision-making.
Employment stability (3 jobs in a year)
Multiple job changes can indicate instability which is moderately associated with increased risks.
Substance use (Marijuana use in past 4 years)
Recent drug use, even with marijuana, can be indicative of a lifestyle that involves some risk factors for recidivism.
The absence of depressive symptoms suggests better psychological stability.
Childhood environment (Lived with biological mother in a small household in an urban area)
Growing up in an urban environment can expose one to higher environmental risk factors despite family support.
A strong spiritual belief may serve as a protective factor by providing a support network and alternative coping mechanisms.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Asian / Pacific Islander. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs between 175 and 199 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has completed a Bachelor's degree and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
